alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN SWITZERLAND AND CARROLL COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 215 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Madison, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Vevay, Pleasant, Fairview, Ghent, Prestonville, Brooksburg, Center Square, Braytown, Locust, Avonburg, Moorefield, Allensville, Mount Sterling and Jacksonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
